stimulusHtml: A fan-powered cart is attached to a spring and is free to move with negligible friction on a straight horizontal track, as shown in the figures. Initially the fan is turned off and the cart is at rest at Point P on the track. The fan is then turned on, resulting in a constant force exerted on the cart. The cart begins to move while the fan remains on. Which of the following describes the motion of the cart with the fan turned on?
choicesHtml: The cart oscillates about Point P in simple harmonic motion.
The cart oscillates about Point P, but not in simple harmonic motion.
The cart oscillates about a point other than Point P in simple harmonic motion.
The cart oscillates about a point other than Point P, but not in simple harmonic motion.
